text: Ida Vitale (born November 2, 1923) is a Uruguayan writer, poet, translator and literary critic. In 2018, she was awarded the Miguel de Cervantes Prize. Vitale fled to Mexico City in 1973 for political asylum after a military junta took power in Uruguay. She played an important role in the Uruguayan art movement known as the 'Generation of 45'.Generación del 45: severa en la crítica y brillante en la creación. ==References== Category:1923 births Category:Living people Category:Writers from Montevideo Category:Uruguayan translators Category:Uruguayan poets Category:Uruguayan activists Category:Miguel de Cervantes Prize winners
title: Ida Vitale
